Class Project

java.lang.Object
Project
public class Project
extends java.lang.Object
The Project class is the class that will be used to instantiate the various projects as objects will certain methods and variables that describe the projects.
Version:
4.0 April 7, 2021
Author:
Jonathan Okeke

    • setProjectName

      public void setProjectName​(java.lang.String newName)
      Assigns the 'newName' parameter as the project name if a name isn't specified during the project creation.
      Parameters:
      newName - The string concatenation of the project's 'buildingType' and customer's first name.

    • changeDeadline

    • updateProjectContractor

      public void updateProjectContractor​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> x)
      Updates the specific project's contractor information. Updates the contractor's phone number, email address or both depending on the user's input.
      Parameters:
      x - An arraylist of size two sent from the updateContractorDetails() Contractor subclass method. Holds either the updated phone number, email address or both depending on the values in x. These arraylist elements will be used to update the the project contractor details.

    • finaliseProject

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> finaliseProject()
      Updates the completion status to "Finalised" and will assign a completion date to the specific project. If the total project fee has not been paid by the customer, the system will generate an invoice indicating the balance to be paid by the customer.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string "projectSummary" that details all the relevant information about a project.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      The string "projectSummary"
